results.title: Kanye West Is Suspended From Twitter After Posting a Swastika
results.abstract: The tweet was deleted before the rapper’s account was shut down. Twitter’s chief executive, Elon Musk, said the post violated a rule against inciting violence.

results.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Kate Conger
results.title: Hate Speech’s Rise on Twitter Is Unprecedented, Researchers Find
results.abstract: Problematic content and formerly barred accounts have increased sharply in the short time since Elon Musk took over, researchers said.

media.caption: Elon Musk, who took over Twitter in October, has described himself as a “free speech absolutist.”

results.adx_keywords: Bears;Cocaine and Crack Cocaine;Smuggling;Movies;Drug Abuse and Traffic;Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Banks, Elizabeth;Georgia
results.title: Yes, ‘Cocaine Bear’ Was Real. Here’s the Back Story.
results.abstract: Nearly 40 years after a 175-pound black bear found and ingested cocaine in a Georgia forest, the drug binge has inspired a movie.

media.caption: The movie “Cocaine Bear” offers a fictionalized account of what happened when a black bear found several pounds of cocaine in Georgia in 1985.
media.copyright: Matt Stone/Courier Journal, via Imagn Content Services

results.title: Alex Jones Files for Bankruptcy
results.abstract: The Infowars broadcaster has been ordered by courts to pay about $1.5 billion in damages to Sandy Hook families hurt by his promotion of conspiracy theories.

media.caption: The personal bankruptcy filing could force a greater degree of scrutiny on the finances of Alex Jones’s empire.

results.adx_keywords: Fashion and Apparel;Child Abuse and Neglect;Child Pornography;Advertising and Marketing;audio-neutral-informative;audio-negative-sad;Gvasalia, Demna;Galimberti, Gabriele;Balenciaga (Fashion Label)
results.byline: By Elizabeth Paton, Vanessa Friedman and Jessica Testa
results.title: When High Fashion and QAnon Collide
results.abstract: Two new Balenciaga campaigns ignited a firestorm that traveled from the internet to Fox News, fueled by allegations that the brand condoned child exploitation.

media.caption: The fallout began on Nov. 16, when Balenciaga published a campaign called Balenciaga Gift Shop, which featured images of children with the brand’s handbags that look like teddy bears in bondage gear.

results.title: Appeals Court Scraps Special Master Review in Trump Documents Case

media.caption: The Justice Department is investigating former President Donald J. Trump’s handling of about 13,000 documents and photographs that were hauled away from Mar-a-Lago by the F.B.I. in August.

results.title: Trump Approved Key Aspect of Company’s Scheme, Prosecutors Assert
results.abstract: Jurors at the Trump Organization trial will begin deliberating Monday after prosecutors presented a document they said showed that the former president had sanctioned tax fraud.

results.title: A Man Fell From a Cruise Ship. And Survived.
results.abstract: He treaded water for hours in the Gulf of Mexico, withstanding rain, winds and waves before he was rescued. Others have not been so lucky. What happens when a person goes overboard?

media.caption: James Grimes, 28, fell from the Carnival Valor sometime after it left the Port of New Orleans on Nov. 23. He was found alive in the Gulf of Mexico on Thanksgiving Day.

results.title: California Panel Sizes Up Reparations for Black Citizens
results.abstract: The state is undertaking the nation’s most ambitious effort so far to compensate for the economic legacy of slavery and racism.

results.title: Applying to College, and Trying to Appear ‘Less Asian’
results.abstract: The affirmative action lawsuit against Harvard seemed to confirm advice given for years to Asian Americans: Don’t play chess, don’t check the box declaring race.
